intro: Anemone rivularis var. daliensis, commonly known as the Dali anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, usually pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers are borne on hairy stems. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
